intro: Kopsia griffithii var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy kopsia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The hairy texture of its foliage is a distinguishing feature that aids in its identification.
